skill.name: drugbank-database
skill.description: Access and analyze comprehensive drug information from the DrugBank database including drug properties, interactions, targets, pathways, chemical structures, and pharmacology data. This skill should be used when working with pharmaceutical data, drug discovery research, pharmacology studies, drug-drug interaction analysis, target identification, chemical similarity searches, ADMET predictions, or any task requiring detailed drug and drug target information from DrugBank.

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation and a local XML helper script. It includes example API calls and local caching paths, which introduce limited network and filesystem exposure when used. The helper script only parses XML data with no network calls, command execution, or credential theft.

low_findings.title: API requests transmit data to DrugBank
low_findings.description: Documentation includes REST API examples: `url = f"https://go.drugbank.com/drugs/{drug_id}.json"` and `response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)`. This sends API credentials over the network when using the DrugBank API.

low_findings.title: Cache writes to user home directory
low_findings.description: Examples write cached data in user home: `drugbank_dir = Path.home() / '.data' / 'drugbank'` and `with open(cache_file, 'wb') as f:`. This writes outside the skill directory for data caching.

content.user_title: Analyze DrugBank data for drug research
content.value_statement: Drug research requires structured access to DrugBank database without manual parsing. This skill provides guidance and helper code to query drugs, interactions, targets, and chemical properties from DrugBank.
actual_capabilities: Download DrugBank data using drugbank-downloader and open XML files for parsing.
Get drug details by DrugBank ID including name, type, indication, and mechanism of action.
List drug-drug interactions and check specific pairs for known interactions.
Extract drug targets with actions, organisms, and UniProt identifiers.
Retrieve calculated and experimental chemical properties and structures (SMILES, InChI).
Search drugs by name with exact or partial matching and filter by drug type.
limitations: Requires a DrugBank account with accepted license for database access.
Needs local DrugBank XML data or a valid DrugBank API key for queries.
Large XML files may be slow to parse on systems with limited memory.
Advanced cheminformatics analyses require external libraries like RDKit.

use_cases.title: Build drug profiles
use_cases.description: Compile identifiers, indications, targets, and interactions for candidate compounds.

use_cases.title: Review polypharmacy risk
use_cases.description: Check known DrugBank interactions for medication lists and summarize risks.

use_cases.title: Create searchable dataset
use_cases.description: Parse DrugBank XML and export structured tables for downstream analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Get drug summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Load DrugBank data and return name, type, indication, and mechanism of action for DB00001.

prompt_templates.title: List interactions
prompt_templates.prompt: List all interactions for DB00001 with partner IDs and descriptions. Summarize the total count.

prompt_templates.title: Compare targets
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare targets for DB00001 and DB00002. Report shared targets and action types.

prompt_templates.title: Export properties
prompt_templates.prompt: Show steps and code to export DrugBank chemical properties to CSV with IDs, names, SMILES, and logP.

output_examples.input: Show details and interactions for DB00001
output: Drug: Lepirudin, biotech drug, indication is thrombin inhibition
Interactions: 42 total including Warfarin with increased bleeding risk
Targets: Thrombin (F2 gene) with known action confirmed

best_practices: Specify the exact DrugBank version for reproducible research and citations.
Cache parsed XML to avoid repeated processing and improve performance.
Validate chemical structures with RDKit before using in modeling workflows.
anti_patterns: Hardcoding DrugBank credentials directly in scripts or configuration files.
Treating DrugBank interaction descriptions as clinical advice for patients.
Using undocumented endpoints or scraping DrugBank web pages instead of API.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides Python guidance that works with all three platforms.

faq.question: What are the data access limits?
faq.answer: Access depends on your DrugBank license and API plan. Free academic tier has rate limits.

faq.question: Can I integrate with pandas or RDKit?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples use pandas for dataframes and reference RDKit for chemistry workflows.

faq.question: Does it send my credentials anywhere?
faq.answer: Only when you call the DrugBank API. Local XML parsing does not transmit credentials.

faq.question: What if downloads fail?
faq.answer: Verify credentials, disk space, and network. Try specifying an older stable version if latest fails.

faq.question: How is this different from generic XML parsers?
faq.answer: It provides DrugBank-specific query patterns and domain-focused examples for drug research.
